title: Riot and their showing of information.
body:
So for anyone new to boards, or even anyone who doesn't know me as a person, i have always pointed out that riot is a bit too... specific, and avoid showing real details with how they choose to show graphs and everything, and i choose to bring this up again because of this topic made by riot 3 days ago.

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/dynamic-queue-matchmaking-update

So i only just today looked at this information, but once again it makes me disappointed in how riot shows their information to us, because it is still telling us nothing.

https://am-a.akamaihd.net/image?f=https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/images/articles/2016/july/DQA/graph-winratesforgroups.jpg?v=1

So lets start with this first one, the thing i want to point out, is that we are looking at 1 in every 1000 games, so this graph while it still covers 0.1% of the games, neglects what i would say would be a more useful graph, of 5v4+1

Now sure, that is very specific, but as riot has said, their system aims to try and give as close as possible to a proper match, and this feels like the one that would be more important in a statistics showing, sure they improved 0.1% of games, but that's not really saying all that much.

Not to mention in my experiences with dynamic this does feel like a few of the games i have been in as a 1.

Not to mention you probably need to look at 3+(2/1+1)V4+1 as well to be getting proper data that shows you are actually fixing the system.

Image number 2 now.

https://am-a.akamaihd.net/image?f=https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/images/articles/2016/july/DQA/graph-skillgap.jpg?v=1

Now this is just a simple thing of, how the fuck are we to know what the statistics are showing, like sure it's showing the numbers, but in a way that just isn't properly readable, i want to say it's down to 3-4%, but i'd have to pull out something to measure it to check, this is a simple thing where marking at 5%'s would be better.

These are just 2 new example of riot specifying their information way too much to mean anything to anyone.

@Riot: Please stop this terrible Information showing where you don't actually show the information properly.

replies.body:
I agree their stats aren't always presented the best way. There was a good discussion over on Reddit that provided some more detailed stats (1/2/3/4/5 man premade against 5 man premade winrates). 

In fact according to the graphs provided in the Reddit thread 4+1 premades actually have a slight advantage over full 5 mans (I can only assume this is due to the  matchmaking adjustments made).

The solo winrate is a little lower, but really all of those are within 2% so it's nothing huge.

NA: http://imgur.com/a/JGJQc

Global: http://imgur.com/a/tCJrM

KR: http://imgur.com/a/uWq3c

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4tsxmo/dynamic_queue_matchmaking_update/d5k1lkh

So the first thing to say.

Why the fuck is this on reddit, and not a part of what they showed, legit this is useful information.

Second, I'm not sure this graph is actually showing anything, the fifth line is a 5 man winrate, so how pray tell, can a 5v5 win more than 50% of the time?

Hell i'm confused as to what any of the lines mean given that other one is wrong.

It's possible the vs is Blue side vs Red side, so Blue side 5 man has a fraction better winrate, but I'm not really sure on that one. It looks like these graphs were taken from internal stats (rather than made specifically for this) so likely it's a limitation of the filters they have immediately available.

As for why they were in the discussion and not in the initial post, likely the team that writes up these stat posts took the "we want to show them but don't want to throw seven gazillion graphs at them how do we condense this", and when people asked for the more specific info that's when Socrates jumped in.

> Why the fuck is this on reddit, and not a part of what they showed, legit this is useful information.

+ It was posted in the comment section for the Dynamic Queue post over on NA and a few other regions. Check it out [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/cgayncZv-dynamic-queue-matchmaking-update?comment=00000004).

 I think they should incorporate a few more numbers into their main posts as well. But keep in mind too much information and analysis will be overwhelming for a lot of players.

I'm not sure what you're asking about the graphs though. Care to clarify for me?
Most consistent stat of all? League of Legends is on the decline, not rise of popularity.

Most people have no idea about stats. Why would they tailor the release for the, say 5%, who have studied a non-trivial amount of higher level stats. Much better to have easy to read stats that retain the critical and supporting ideas. In this case, match quality has improved. 

>but as riot has said, their system aims to try and give as close as possible to a proper match

Which is exactly why they showed this graph- It shows how over the three periods matches have increased in the given quality metric. 


-------------------------

Also, you're criticising them for being too specific and asking for stats that are even _more_ specific.

>Much better to have easy to read stats that retain the critical and supporting ideas.

Easy to read stats, yet i can't really tell you what the stats are for that second picture, sure they are better, but this isn't the point.

>Which is exactly why they showed this graph- It shows how over the three periods matches have increased in the given quality metric.

That's pathetic, again we are talking about the 0.1% of games, this isn't actually saying the quality has increased in a broad sense, only over these small amounts of games.

>Also, you're criticising them for being too specific and asking for stats that are even more specific.

They are using specific stats that look good for them, THAT is my problem, they need to give us stats that don't just show us the 0.1%, and that show us that it's a matter of all games are getting better not just 0.1%
